pain_points.description: The website's general appearance is unpleasing and does not represent the beauty of Santa Barbara.
supporting_quotes: the general appearance of the website is not pleasing.
the picture of any place isn't attractive at all.
pain_points.impact: Users may feel disconnected from the community and less inclined to engage with the club.

pain_points.description: The website navigation is clunky and outdated, making it difficult to move through and find information.
supporting_quotes: the website is clunky, it's out of date in terms of navigation.
the navigation between the calendar view and the list view is very clunky.
pain_points.frequency_severity: High - repeatedly mentioned and seen as a major obstacle.
pain_points.current_workarounds: Users may try to remember specific paths or rely on others' guidance.
pain_points.impact: Frustration in finding information, which can lead to disengagement.

pain_points.description: Redundant information across different sections of the website creates confusion.
supporting_quotes: it's the same committee's listing, and yet in this case, it also has the chairs.
pain_points.frequency_severity: Medium - mentioned multiple times but with less emotional intensity.
pain_points.current_workarounds: Users may try to cross-reference sections to find unique information.
pain_points.impact: Users may waste time and become frustrated trying to get clear information.

pain_points.description: The frequently asked questions (FAQs) section is minimal and not representative of users' needs.
supporting_quotes: the frequently asked questions is minimal.
there's only five questions, that's hardly representative.
pain_points.frequency_severity: Medium - concerns about usefulness were raised.
pain_points.current_workarounds: Users might seek help from other members or outside resources.
pain_points.impact: New users may feel unsupported and confused about joining or participating.

pain_points.description: Event registration process has inconsistencies, such as registrations being closed unexpectedly.
supporting_quotes: the functioning of the registration process is occasionally out of whack.
an event that has not happened... will have registration closed.
pain_points.frequency_severity: Medium - mentioned as a significant issue when hosting events.
pain_points.current_workarounds: Users may contact event organizers directly to rectify registration issues.
pain_points.impact: Potential attendees may miss out on events or feel frustrated with the process.

pain_points.description: The organization of volunteer opportunities is inefficient and not user-friendly.
supporting_quotes: it's organized by, alphabetically, by the organization, as opposed to the type of volunteer.
it doesn't make any sense, it's inefficient and ineffective.
pain_points.frequency_severity: Medium - users expressed confusion and frustration.
pain_points.current_workarounds: Users may try to remember organizations or contact coordinators for help.
pain_points.impact: Users may miss out on opportunities that align with their interests.

pain_points.description: The contact us section is poorly organized and haphazard, making it hard to find relevant information.
supporting_quotes: the organization of the drop-downs is ineffective.
the first thing you see is your own profile, it's update your own profile.
pain_points.frequency_severity: Low - mentioned but not as a primary concern.
pain_points.current_workarounds: Users may rely on other members for contact information.
pain_points.impact: Users may struggle to get timely help or information.
